summary: This is an email chain between FBI legal personnel discussing a newly filed lawsuit (Does 1-12 v. US) alleging FBI negligence in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The email includes forwarding of administrative claims related to Epstein and notes the complaint was filed on February 14, 2024.

persons.name: SSA Chief Division Counsel FBI-New York
persons.context: Sends an email attaching two administrative claims received regarding Jeffrey Epstein and states they will forward hard copies.

persons.name: Assistant General Counsel Litigation Branch I OGC Federal Bureau of Investigation
persons.context: Sends an email notifying recipients about a complaint filed on February 14, 2024, alleging FBI negligence in relation to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the administrative claims and the negligence lawsuit against the FBI.

connections.person1: SSA Chief Division Counsel FBI-New York
connections.person2: Assistant General Counsel Litigation Branch I OGC Federal Bureau of Investigation
connections.description: Communicating via email regarding legal matters (administrative claims and a lawsuit) related to Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.person1: SSA Chief Division Counsel FBI-New York
connections.description: The counsel is handling administrative claims related to Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.person1: Assistant General Counsel Litigation Branch I OGC Federal Bureau of Investigation
connections.description: The counsel is notifying about a lawsuit alleging FBI negligence in relation to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Lawsuit Filed Against FBI
events.description: A complaint (Does 1-12 v. US) was filed alleging negligence by the FBI in relation to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Administrative Claims Received
events.description: Two administrative claims regarding Jeffrey Epstein were received (the day before the email).

locations: 935 Pennsylvania Ave NW, Room 10140 Washington, DC 20535
keyFacts: A lawsuit titled 'Does 1-12 v. US' was filed on February 14, 2024, in the SDNY, alleging negligence by the FBI in relation to Jeffrey Epstein.
The FBI's Office of the General Counsel was aware of the lawsuit but had not been formally served as of February 16, 2024.
Two administrative claims related to Jeffrey Epstein were received by the FBI's New York Division Counsel on or about February 15, 2024.
The email communication is between FBI legal personnel and is marked as potentially privileged and confidential.
